snippet: Scientists at CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, say they need more data to understand how the particle works and what it means for the universe.
abstract: Scientists at CERN, European Organization for Nuclear Research, say new subatomic particle discovered in summer 2012 definitely looks like Higgs boson, but they need more data to understand how particle works and what it means for universe.
lead_paragraph: Scientists at CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, say they need more data to understand how the particle works and what it means for the universe.

headline.main: CERN Physicists See Higgs Boson in New Particle
headline.print_headline: Particle Appears To Be a Higgs
